summary: This is an email forwarding Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell (20Cr330). The email chain shows the disclosures were sent from defense attorney Jeffrey Pagliuca's office (via Nicole Simmons) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Sends the email containing Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 16 disclosures to the U.S. Attorney's Office on behalf of Jeffrey Pagliuca.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Requested that his office send Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures to the prosecution.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (U.S. v. Maxwell, 20Cr330) and the person whose Rule 16 disclosures are being provided.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email containing the Rule 16 disclosures, indicating her involvement in Maxwell's defense team.

connections.description: Pagliuca is part of Maxwell's defense team, as evidenced by his office sending her Rule 16 disclosures.
Menninger is copied on the disclosure email, indicating she is part of Maxwell's legal defense team.
Simmons sends the email at Pagliuca's request, indicating she works for his law firm, Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

events.title: Maxwell's Rule 16 Disclosures Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team provides her Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures to the prosecution in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is an email forwarding Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures in her criminal case (20Cr330).
The disclosures were sent from Maxwell's defense team, specifically from attorney Jeffrey Pagliuca's office, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email indicates ongoing pre-trial discovery and legal proceedings in Maxwell's case as of November 2021.
The defense law firm involved is identified as Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.
